name: Create a tag object

params.name: tag
params.description: The tag's name. This is typically a version (e.g., "v0.0.1").

params.name: object
params.description: The SHA of the git object this is tagging.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the object we're tagging. Normally this is a `commit` but it can also be a `tree` or a `blob`.

params.name: tagger
params.description: An object with information about the individual creating the tag.

params.name: tagger.name
params.description: The name of the author of the tag

params.name: tagger.email
params.description: The email of the author of the tag

params.name: tagger.date
params.description: When this object was tagged. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

description: Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do this call to create the tag object, and then [create](/enterprise/2.12/v3/git/refs/#create-a-reference) the `refs/tags/[tag]` reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to [create](/enterprise/2.12/v3/git/refs/#create-a-reference) the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.
